Description: Estimated number of people requiring humanitarian assistance in a crisis context (caseload).

Disaggregation: By severity, gender, age, population type, sector, disability, and geography (often Admin 1–2, depending on data availability)

Description: Dataset of which organisations (Who) are doing what activities (What) in which locations (Where).
Sources:

Countries: Countries with active coordination mechanism (OCHA or others)

Description: Official administrative boundary datasets (COD-AB) for humanitarian coordination and geospatial use.
Sources: Common Operational Datasets (COD) maintained by OCHA and national authorities (new FISS process).
Disaggregation: Geographic administrative units: Admin 0, Admin 1, Admin 2 (and possibly Admin 3) depending on country dataset.

A centralized price database covering 1,900 active markets in 60 countries, price alerts(ALPS) and forecasts as well as official and parallel exchange rates, visualized in the WFP DataViz Economic Explorer.
Sources: WFP country offices, governments and partners

Description:
The Market Functionality Index (MFI) is a composite index based on nine dimensions with and end-to-end data pipeline providing results in 24 hours. It has been ssed to assess 5,000 markets in 73 countries, visualized in the WFP DataViz Economic
Explorer. A piloted MFI-Nutrition is also available to support nutrition sensitive interventions.

WFP is conducting food security assessments (face-to-face or remote) in all its operations. These include key food security indicators such as the Food Consumption Score, the reduced Coping Strategies Index, the Food Excpenditure Share or Economic Capacity to Meet Essential Needs, the Livelihood Coping Strategies Index used to calculate the Consolidated Approach for Reporting Indicators of Food Security. Furthermore, WFP often collects the Household Hunger Scale and Household Dietary Diversity Score
Disaggregation: Varies but often at Admin 2 level

Description: Climate indicators, derived from remote sensing / Earth Observation models and source datasets. Data available as gridded rasters and derived datasets such as global administrative aggregations. Includes full archives, near real time and forecast data.
Sources: NASA, ESA, UCSB, ECMWF and other providers
Disaggregation: At various raster resolutions, aggregated up to admin level 2
API or main ingestion source: Rainfall and NDVI datasets published on HDX

Description: Global hazard data for tropical storms, floods and eathquakes
Sources: USGS, NASA, NOAA, MeteoFrance and others

Description: Full archives of Earth Observation / Remote sensing datasets (NDVI, LST, ...)
Disaggregation: At various raster resolutions, aggregated up to admin level 2
API or main ingestion source: Rainfall and NDVI datasets published on HDX

Description: Set of standard questions and modules to be used during primary data collection exercises. Implements operational approaches to collect food security and vulnerability information.
Administrative boundaries (0-4) - humanitarian data
